notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the end. Slightly water-damaged.
Se'adyah ben Shelomoh: probably a compiler of this manuscript: inscribed, folio 61r. The Judeo-Arabic sentence at the end of Deuteronomy, folio 189v, implies that the author had employed a copyist.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Midrashim in Hebrew and Arabic on Leviticus, Numbers and Deuteronomy, followed by a short midrashic commentary on the Hafṭarot.

collation.p: 19 quires of 10 leaves each, 1 quire (no. 20) of 8 leaves, and 1 quire (no. 21) of 7 leaves - defective, plus a detached leaf at the end. Signed with Hebrew letters at the beginning and at the end of quires.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Midrash. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 1422.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Fischl Hirsch: purchased by the British Library from him on 12 January 1877: inscribed, folio [208v].
